name: FutureGroup
comment:
A collection of quiver/dart-async.Futures that signals when all added Futures complete. New Futures can be added to the group as long as it hasn't completed.

FutureGroup is useful for managing a set of async tasks that may spawn new async tasks as they execute.

failedTask.name: failedTask
failedTask.comment: Gets the task that failed, if any.

future.name: future
future.comment:
A Future that complets with a List of the values from all the added tasks, when they have all completed.

If any task fails, this Future will receive the error. Only the first error will be sent to the Future.

add.name: add
add.comment:
Wait for quiver/quiver-async.FutureGroup.add.task to complete.

If this group has already been marked as completed, a dart-core.StateError will be thrown.

If this group has a quiver/quiver-async.FutureGroup.failedTask, new tasks will be ignored, because the error has already been signaled.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides quiver/quiver-async.FutureGroup.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and quiver/quiver-async.FutureGroup.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the quiver/quiver-async.FutureGroup.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
quiver/quiver-async.FutureGroup.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to quiver/quiver-async.FutureGroup.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If quiver/quiver-async.FutureGroup.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of quiver/quiver-async.FutureGroup.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
